title: Can we talk about Protobelt?
body:
Seriously, this item needs to be nerfed. It was supposed to be an item that low mobility champions could buy to get close, but for whatever reason Riot decided to make it's active do significantly more damage than any of the other hextech items, while also making it the most cost efficient of the bunch.

The bolts from the active shouldn't damage the same target multiple times. Seriously.

replies.body:
From the pre-season patch hopefully hitting PBE tomorrow:

Protobelt

* Damage taken per additional bolt :: Decreased from 20% >>> 10%
* AP Ratio :: Decreased from 0.35 to 0.25

Short context: Yep, we agree it's putting out too much damage, which removes what should be more of a damage versus mobility trade off.

Heimerdinger was actually one of our main points of reference when we looked for a name/appearance for Protobelt. We weren't thinking it was necessarily something he'd made himself, but did want it to look like the same sort of hextech work he did.

It could easily come from either his workshop in Bandle City, or from the Piltover Academy. The whole Hextech series of items you guys rolled out have been pretty good, both visually as well as "lorewise", as the guy above refers to it as.

There was a reddit post with the maths about protobelt missiles damage. They are broken because every consecutive missile hit multiplies damage x1.25 instead of adding 25% of original missile damage. Just fix that

We'll get that fixed and then probably reduce the nerf a bit as a result. Version going to the PBE today will likely be the numbers quoted above though still.

I have a problem with this item because i don't know who Protobelt was intended for. It is used by champions that already have high or decent mobility to make their kits even more mobile and reliable ({{champion:85}} , {{champion:131}} ) as well as giving them even more burst. Just like Flash giving safety and reliabilit to already mobile champions, it is fairly obvious this item would be abused by mobile burst mages to add more mobility and burst. Was this who it was intended for? I can understand that, but it is too overtuned for them right now, but if they are not who it was intended for I think this item needs to be slightly reworked.

Just like Flash giving safety and reliabilit to already mobile champions, it is fairly obvious this item would be abused by mobile burst mages to add more mobility and burst. Was this who it was intended for? I can understand that, but it is too overtuned for them right now, but if they are not who it was intended for I think this item needs to be slightly reworked.

Its intended for people who want to get into your face, but lack the mobility to do so (which is why some of them were so reliant on flash engages)

Swain wants to get into the middle of a teamfight to get the maximum health return from his ravens, Kennen wants to get as close as he can to your team to maximize the effectiveness of his ultimate (likewise for Annie). Probably some inaccurate examples, but thats generally what its aimed for.

Stat wise, the item is fine; the active damage is pretty crazy though, I'm surprised they didn't just make it apply a flat damage regardless of # of bolts hit, and then a DoT that scales with AP (since you know its well..... fire lol), make the projectiles spread over a wider area to maximize its active effect; without the damage being absolutely absurd.

As someone who plays Swain, I think that Swain needs compensation buffs if this item gets removed. Swain is so hard to play into mobile champions, which is almost the entire meta. The problem, as mentioned, is champions that have burst and/or mobility that buy this item. Just like DFG made bursty champs more bursty.

Seriously, though, I will trade this item for ad champs getting no grievous wounds.

i really dont agree with the meta being mobility at all, i think all the popular midlaners are immobile champions, outside of aurelion sol but his mobility is outside of combat, and the most popular adcs are cait and jhin who are both fairly immobile as well, i know cait has her e but it is on a long cooldown and the dash isnt that far at all.

Yea but those champions that want this item are being pushed beyond their balance limits because of it, a great example of this would be Kennen who is completely overwhelming when he has proto+zhonya. Since nothing had been done to Protobelt, I assumed it was because these were not the intended champions, but then none of the champions were being worked on... So it left me confused as to who it was intended for, its too strong on the group that is building it.  

Swain is the only champion I have seen build this who doesn't have any mobility in their kit. However we need to ask ourselves, do we want to give Swain the ability to dash into a teamfight? Is he not balanced with the idea in mind that he needs to run into the enemies in order to maximize his effectiveness and that puts him at risk of being CC'd or his enemies escaping? Doesn't this item sort of negate a lot of the weaknesses of Swain while at the same time amplifying his strengths?   

So again I am confused, because I don't think champions like Swain and Kennen should be building this item. They are balanced around not having the ability to dash into a team and to suddenly give them this ability creates a ton of issues (not so much with Swain). I don't think Protobelt should take the place of rebalancing them, becoming completely dependent on an item is not great balance. Synergy with an item is good, but complete dependence is not. It is why Mordekaiser will be effected extremely hard by any Rylai's changes, because he is completely reliant on that item. We don't want protobelt effecting Kennen and Swain like it is. This item is just too strong in the right hands because of its burst and reliability.
TBH, Swain already crutches on protobelt. I won't play him without it.
this is what we should be avoiding with items like protobelt that offer as much as they do.

While giving mobile champions even more mobility and giving free flash engages (which do damage) to burst initiation champs like Kennen and Annie.  Great idea Riot...what could go wrong?

In my defense, I brought it up when it was debuted and was screamed at by the Riot leg-humpers for criticizing something clearly unhealthy and not thought out well enough.
To be honest its a unique and interesting item but just offers too many stats at the moment. It needs a stat adjustment (including bolt nerf) and it would be just fine imo
